q:
You are asked to use two pipes A and B to fill a tank that has another pipe C at the bottom of it. Given that pipes A and B can fill the tank in 15 and 20 minutes, respectively and pipe C can empty 5 gallons per minute from the tank.
In the given context, what is the capacity of the tank if all three pipes working together can fill the tank in 10 minutes?

You have two pipes P1 and P2 that can fill a large bucket in 4 hours and 2 hours, respectively. Also, assume that you open the pipes at alternate hours.
In the given context, how many hours will it take to fill the bucket if you open P1 first?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

You have three pipes P1, P2, and P3 that fill a tank completely in 5 hours, 10 hours, and 15 hours, respectively. You open P1, P2, and P3 for 2 hours each in sequence.

Approximately, how many hours will P1 take to fill the tank completely?

A large concrete bed is filled using five small pipes and two large pipes. Each of the five small pipes works at 2/5 the rate of the large pipe. If all the 7Â pipes are opened at the same time, they should fill the entire bed in what fraction of time that it would have taken the large pipe alone?

Bob is using two taps A and B to fill a tank in 12 hours and 15 hours, respectively. He opens both the taps and observes that it took him 20 minutes more to fill the tank due to some leakage.
How long will the leakage take to empty a full tank in the given scenario?
Note: Select the accurate time in hours and minutes.

There are 16 pipes that are connected to a tank. Some of them are used to fill the tank and the others are used to drain the tank. Each of the fill pipes can fill the tank in 12 hours and each of the drain pipes can drain the tank completely in 8 hours.
If all the pipes and drain pipes are kept open, an empty tank gets filled in 12 hours. Determine the count of fill pipes out of all the 16 pipes?
